Text.Text: I am Vese Nejj.  What would you have of me?
My business is my own.  I would remind you that you are a visitor.  You have no authority to question any who reside here.
Then you seek Saablic Tan.  However, he is away right now.  In his absence, I can help you.  What is it that you require?
No, I cannot.  Our work is confidential enclave business.  You are not privy to such information.  Unless...
Well, there is a task that you could perform for the enclave.  Were you to accomplish this, I would be willing to offer you membership.
One of the towers here contains an extensive library on the magical arts.  We would like to gain access to this library. Unfortunately, entry to the tower has been denied to us.

The tower is held by a rival mage.  He has warded it against magical entry, and he has set up a puzzle at the entrance.  I need someone to solve this puzzle, gain entry to the tower, and then report to me how it is accomplished.

The base of the tower was destroyed in a war ages ago.  The debris floats in the air, much like islands in the sea, with the remainder of the tower above.  On the islands are a series of portals which must be activated in a certain pattern.
If the portals are not activated in the proper sequence, the user is slain.
I have reason to believe that the portals are only warded against members of the enclave.  You may be able to activate them freely.
I tried to ascertain the pattern by using slaves.  Any slave who activated one of the portals was instantly transported elsewhere.
I neither know, nor care.  My concern at this point is gaining access to the tower.  Will you solve the portal puzzle or not?
Excellent...  The base of the tower can be reached from the fourth floor.  It is there that you will encounter the puzzle.  Report back to me when you have solved it.
You would do well to ally yourself with the enclave, friend.  There is little else in this matter worthy of consideration.
You would do well to ally yourself with the enclave, friend.  Refusing us is a serious mistake.
That is a very serious accusation.  What evidence do you have that lends credence to your belief?
I see...  Yes...  You have convinced me.  I will see to it that Cedrin is punished for his crime.

You would be allied with a powerful magical group.  You would benefit from our protection, and we from yours.  From time to time you would be given profitable assignments.  You stand to make a fortune.
He calls himself Orrick the Grey.  He once hailed from Kuldahar, but has since taken up residence here.
I have done so on numerous occasions.  However, he has steadfastly refused.  He must now pay the price for his refusal...
No, I intend to oust him from the tower and claim it in the name of the enclave.
Of course.  The life of a slave is inconsequential compared to that of one of my people, or what could be learned from the library in that tower.
If that is your belief, then perhaps we should not be speaking.
Good riddance to him, then.  Is there anything else you need?
You have returned.  I am Vese Nejj.  What would you have of me?
You have returned.  When we last spoke, I asked you to find a solution to the portal puzzle in the Mage's Tower.  If memory serves, you refused.  Have you reconsidered?
You have returned.  When we last spoke, I asked you to find a solution to the portal puzzle in the Mage's Tower.  If memory serves, you were considering the matter.  Have you come to a decision?
You have returned.  When we last spoke, I asked you to find a solution to the portal puzzle in the Mage's Tower.  Have you done so?
What is the solution?
You have done well.  Now, there is another task I need to assign you.
And so I shall...  After you complete this final task for me.
Now that you have access to the tower, return there and pick up a few things for me.
There are three items within the tower that I require.  They are Larrel's Bones, the Book of the Mythal, and Orrick's spellbook.
Good.  When you return with the items, the offer of membership in the enclave is yours.  Go now.
Orrick believes his tower to be inaccessible by any who pose a threat to him.  It is unlikely that the book is protected at all.  You are seeing danger where none exists.

You have already betrayed Orrick by revealing the secret of the portals to me.  What do you think he will do to you when he discovers this?  Your best bet is to bring me the items I require.  By doing so you are effectively removing him as a threat to you...
You have returned.  Do you have the items that I requested?
You have done well.  Give the items to me.
You have exceeded my expectations of you.  Unfortunately, I have no further tasks for you.  Return to me at another time.
Very well, I hereby offer you membership in the enclave.  Now, of course, it must be approved by a majority vote of the current membership.  However, I doubt that will happen.
Membership is only open to those of Thayvian blood.  I do not believe that you qualify in that respect.
No, I honored my part of the bargain exactly as I stated it to you.  I said that I would *offer* you membership.  I did not promise that you would be accepted.
Do not threaten me, you impudent dog.  I will slay you where you stand!  Now, begone!
I have nothing to say to you.  Begone!
You have returned.  I still need you to retrieve Larrel's Bones, the Book of the Mythal, and Orrick's spellbook.  What say you?
How dare you come before me after betraying my trust in you!  Leave now, you impudent dog, or suffer a thousand deaths!
And what might that be?

Very well.  As a Red Wizard of Thay, I can perform tattoo magic.  I will give you a tattoo of your choice.  You may choose to have one of the following: Greater Fortitude, Lightning Reflexes, or Iron Will.  Is this acceptable?
Well, I have nothing else to offer you.
Keep in mind that if you already possess one of these abilities a tattoo will not increase them.  Choose only that which you need.  Now.  Which tattoo would you like?
Very well.  Who shall I tattoo with Iron Will?
Very well.  Who shall I tattoo with Great Fortitude?
Very well.  Who shall I tattoo with Lightning Reflexes?
Very well.  Return to me when you have decided what tattoo you would like.
It is done.  The terms of our agreement are fulfilled, and I have no further need of your services.  Farewell.
You have returned.  If memory serves, you were deciding upon a tattoo.  Have you come to a decision?
I have nothing to say to you.  Why have you returned?
Excellent.  Then you should have little trouble acquiring the remaining items.  Return to me when you have them all.  Go now.
What are you doing here?
I am looking for the person in charge here.
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
I am looking for the person in charge here.
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
I am curious about what is going on here.  Can you tell me?
I believe that a member of your enclave, Zaem Astyr, was murdered by Cedrin Zil, the librarian.
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
Unless what?
What task do you speak of?
What does membership in the enclave entitle me to?
Oh?  Why is that?
What kind of puzzle?
Who is this rival mage?
That does not sound difficult.  What are you not telling me?
I see.  That sheds a new light on things.
Slain?  And you expect me to be able to survive?
Oh?  What makes you think so?
I will need a lot more evidence than that before I agree to anything.
Where?
You used slaves knowing that they could be slain?
Very well, I shall do so.
I will take the matter under consideration.
I have no desire to become involved in this affair.
I happen to have already solved the puzzle.  I have been to the Wizard's Tower.
Very well, farewell.
Very well, I shall do as you ask.
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
Very well, I shall do as you ask.
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
Allow me to explain...
The matter has been handled.  Cedrin Zil is dead.
I believe justice should prevail in this matter.
It is your affair, handle it as you see fit.
I see.  What is this task you spoke of?
Why not just ask him for access to the library?
So this is not just a matter of gaining access to the library?
I see.  So, tell me about this puzzle.
You have a cold attitude toward life.
I see your point.  So where were the slaves sent?
Perhaps, but I would like to know where the slaves were sent.
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
I am curious about what is going on here.  Can you tell me?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
What are you doing here?
I am looking for the person in charge here.
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
Very well, I shall do as you ask.
There is a matter of some importance that I must speak to you about.
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
Very well, I shall do as you ask.
There is a matter of some importance that I must speak to you about.
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
Yes, I have solved the puzzle.
There is a matter of some importance that I must speak to you about.
No, I am still working on it.  Farewell.
The pattern is as follows...
What is this task?
Wait.  You said that you would offer me membership in the enclave if I completed this task for you.
What would you have me do?
What things?
Very well, I shall do as you ask.
Surely you jest.  I cannot just walk in there and steal his spellbook.
I cannot just walk in there and steal his spellbook.  I cannot even fathom the protection wards that must be on it.
I already have those items with me, Vese.
I already have some of those items with me, Vese.
I already have some of those items with me, Vese.
I already have some of those items with me, Vese.
I already have some of those items with me, Vese.
I already have some of those items with me, Vese.
I already have some of those items with me, Vese.
You better hope so, or you will never see those items.
Very well.  Farewell.
Very well, I shall do as you ask.
I think not.  I will not do this.
Very well, I shall do as you ask.
I will take the matter under consideration.
No, I am still working on it.  Farewell.
Yes.  I have them here with me.
There is a matter of some importance that I must speak to you about.
Very well, here they are...
Wait.  You said that you would offer me membership in the enclave if I completed this task for you.
Why is that?
You failed to mention this to me before.  You deceived me!
Either you compensate me for my efforts, or I will take those items off your dead body, Vese.
I went to a lot of trouble to get those items for you.  I feel that I should be compensated for my efforts, Vese.
I took those items from Orrick; I can take them back from you.  Unless, of course, you compensate me for my efforts, Vese.
Either admit me to the enclave, or face the consequences!
Very well, farewell.
No!  Prepare to die!
There is a matter of some importance that I must speak to you about.
Very well, farewell.
Very well, I shall do so.
There is a matter of some importance that I must speak to you about.
I am still considering the matter.  Farewell.
No.  I think you will be the one to die!
There is a matter of some importance that I must speak to you about.
Very well, farewell.
I believe that a member of your enclave, Zaem Astyr, was murdered by Cedrin Zil, the librarian.
Never mind.  I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
Yes, I would like a tattoo.
I have no need of any of those.
I see.  Well, this will teach me to have no further dealings with you.  Farewell.
Then I will take your life instead.
I would like to have Iron Will.
I would like to have Great Fortitude.
I would like to have Lightning Reflexes.
This matter requires some thought on my part.
Tattoo <PLAYER1>.
Tattoo <PLAYER2>.
Tattoo <PLAYER3>.
Tattoo <PLAYER4>.
Tattoo <PLAYER5>.
Tattoo <PLAYER6>.
This matter requires some thought on my part.

Tattoo <PLAYER6>.

Tattoo <PLAYER1>.
Tattoo <PLAYER2>.
Tattoo <PLAYER3>.
Tattoo <PLAYER4>.
Tattoo <PLAYER5>.
Tattoo <PLAYER6>.
This matter requires some thought on my part.
Farewell for now.
Very well, farewell.
Yes, I have.
No, I need more time.  Farewell.
There is a matter of some importance that I must speak to you about.
Never mind.  I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
Very well, farewell.
